page.title: 06Ecology in Rawdon-2
page.content: As part of class ones study of the local ecology a detailed investigation of the "{minibeasts}"of the area was undertaken.We found representatives from most of the insect groups:-moths and butterflies,dragon and damselflies caddis flies,lacewings,wasps bees,ants plant galls,beetles,ladybir(two spot both black and red-seven spot and twenty two spot black on yellow), earwigs,spiders,millipedes,earth worms centipedes,snails,woodlice and slugs. In the dam there were sticklebacks and minnows,water snail,pond skates, tadpoles and water spiders.All these creatures were found in large numbers.
